==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|まん|じゅう|yomi=o}}
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=まんじゅう}} {{m|zh|饅頭}}.

Note that in modern Chinese, {{lang|zh|饅頭}} means an ''unfilled'' bun;
{{m|zh|包子|tr=bāozi}} is the term for a filled bun.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|y=o|まんじゅう|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Noun===
[[Image:Age manju at Takemura, Kanda, Tokyo.jpg|thumb|right|'''{{lang|ja|饅頭}}''']]
{{ja-noun|まんじゅう|hhira=まんぢゆう}}

# {{w|manjū}}, a type of [[bun]] typically with [[bean]] [[paste]] filling
